NewMonopoly

Class Functions

  • java.lang.Object
    • NewMonopoly.Functions

  • class Functions
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages most of the game's functions available to the players
    Author:
    Miguel Salazar

    • Constructor Detail

      • Functions

        public Functions(javax.swing.JButton[][] aB,
                 javax.swing.ImageIcon[][] bc)
        Default Constructor. Only initializes the two parameters
        Parameters:
        aB - a JButton[][], stored in arrButton, that populates the whole board within a GridLayout
        bc - an ImageIcon[][], stored in boardColors, that populates the icon of each JButton stored in arrButton

    • Method Detail

      • endGame

        public void endGame(Player player)
        Determines if a player has gone bankrupt and begins the bankruptcy process. First assets are calculated, assets are then sold back to the bank or mortgaged if doing so would save the player from losing. Otherwise, they player's assets are given away and the player is no longer active.
        Parameters:
        player - an ArrayList of Player objects containing the list of active players

      • winner

        public void winner(Player p)
        Whoever is passed through this method wins the game! All players are
        Parameters:
        p -

      • upDownGrade

        public PropManagerFrame upDownGrade(Player play,
                                    java.util.ArrayList<Suit> su,
                                    boolean sellOnly)
        Special instance of upDownGrade that requires a boolean where, if true, the property manager will only allow downgrading properties
        Parameters:
        play - the player object belonging of the person who's currently playing
        su - the ArrayList of Suit objects containing every suit in the game
        sellOnly - a special boolean telling the property manager to enable or disable upgrading, if true-only downgrading is allowed, if false- upgrading and downgrading is allowed
        Returns:
        the PropManagerFrame object. Used only when only downgrading is possible

      • upDownGrade

        public void upDownGrade(Player play,
                        java.util.ArrayList<Suit> su)
        Starts the Property Manager (PropManagerFrame). Begins by selecting which suits are valid to modify and then prepares the elements needed by the Property Manager.
        Parameters:
        play - the player object belonging of the person who's currently playing
        su - the ArrayList of Suit objects containing every suit in the game

      • mortgage

        public void mortgage()
        A go between method that first determines who's turn it is, then passes corresponding Player object to mortgage(Player) which is used when mortgaging and unmortgaging is allowed
        See Also:
        mortgage(Player)

      • mortgage

        public MortManagerFrame mortgage(boolean mo)
        A go between method that first determines who's turn it is, then passes corresponding Player object to mortgage(Player, boolean) which is used when only mortgaging is allowed
        Parameters:
        mo - boolean value denoting if only mortgaging is allowed
        Returns:
        the MortManager used when only unmortgaging properties is allowed
        See Also:
        mortgage(Player, boolean)

      • mortgage

        public void mortgage(Player p)
        Begins Mortgage Manager allowing players to mortgage and unmortgage their properties
        Parameters:
        p - Player object of the player who wishes to place properties for mortgage

      • mortgage

        public MortManagerFrame mortgage(Player p,
                                 boolean mo)
        Begins Mortgage Manager allowing players to only mortgage their properties
        Parameters:
        p - Player object of the player who wishes to place properties for mortgage
        mo - boolean value where if true, properties can only be mortgaged
        Returns:
        the MortManagerFrame created by the method

      • trader

        public void trader()
        Begins Trader Manager allowing players to trade assets with other players WORK IN PROGRESS

      • moving

        public void moving(Player pl)
        moving assumes that the dice roll has already added to the position and repositions the player to the correct new position
        Parameters:
        pl - a Player object defining which player must be moved

      • clear

        public void clear(int id)
        Clears the board of any images with the passed id number
        Parameters:
        id - an int identifying what images to search for

      • move

        public void move(Player pl)
        Changes the ImageIcon at the passed Player object's position to signify the Player's position
        Parameters:
        pl - the Player who's displayed position on the board must be updated

      • propFinder

        public void propFinder(java.util.ArrayList<Player> players,
                       java.util.ArrayList<Property> properties)
        Determines what the player has landed on and acts accordingly
        Parameters:
        players - the Player object who's position is being inspected
        properties - the ArrayList of Property object's containing all the properties in the game

      • propFunc

        public void propFunc(Player play,
                     java.util.ArrayList<Player> players,
                     java.util.ArrayList<Property> properties)
        Called by propFinder(ArrayList, ArrayList) when the player lands on a Property. This method determines who landed on who's property, if owned, or makes the property available, if not owned
        Parameters:
        play - the Player object who has landed on a property
        players - the ArrayList of Player objects containing all players in the game
        properties - the ArrayList of Property objects containing all properties in the game
        See Also:
        propFinder(ArrayList, ArrayList)

      • chance

        public void chance(Player p,
                   java.util.ArrayList<Player> players,
                   java.util.ArrayList<Property> properties)
        Called by propFinder(ArrayList, ArrayList) when the player lands on a chance space
        Parameters:
        p - the Player object who has landed the chance space
        players - the ArrayList of Player objects containing all players in the game
        properties - the ArrayList of Property objects containing all properties in the game
        See Also:
        propFinder(ArrayList, ArrayList)

      • commchest

        public void commchest(Player p,
                      java.util.ArrayList<Player> players,
                      java.util.ArrayList<Property> properties)
        Called by propFinder(ArrayList, ArrayList) when the player lands on a Community Chest space
        Parameters:
        p - the Player object who has landed the Community Chest space
        players - the ArrayList of Player objects containing all players in the game
        properties - the ArrayList of Property objects containing all properties in the game
        See Also:
        propFinder(ArrayList, ArrayList)

      • jailRole

        public void jailRole(Player pl)
        Called if a player is in jail. Prompts player to try for bail or rolls for release
        Parameters:
        pl - Player object of the player in jail

      • jail

        public void jail(Player p)
        Send the passed player to jail
        Parameters:
        p - Player object of the player being sent to jail

      • directory

        public java.lang.String directory(int pos)
        Used by propFinder(ArrayList, ArrayList) to determine what the player has landed on
        Parameters:
        pos - int primitive describing the player's position on the board
        Returns:
        String describing the type of square the player is currently on
